newsitem.title: FINLAND: Partek sets concrete j/v with Sweden firms.
newsitem.headline: Partek sets concrete j/v with Sweden firms.

text.p: Finnish building materials and cargo handling equipment group Partek Oy Ab said in a statememt on Friday it would set up a new concrete element joint venture with a unit of Sweden's Addum AB and with Industri Kapital AB.
The new company, with annual net sales of 2.7 billion markka, would be made up of Partek's concrete element operations and Addum's Strangbetong AB subsidiary.
Partek and Addum will own 40 percent each of the new company, and Industri Kapital will hold 20 percent, Partek said.
Industri Kapital owns 70 percent of Addum, Partek said.
"Partek, Swedish development company Addum and venture capital company Industri Kapital have reached a preliminary agreement to establish a strong European precast concrete company," Partek said.
"The intention is to broaden the company's ownership base later," it added, but did not elaborate.

Setting the precast concrete joint venture was part of the strategy outlined by Partek as it merged with engineering group Sisu Oy in January, it said, adding the new concrete j/v would release "a significant amount of capital". It gave no details.
